page.title: 09West Wratting Area: Crops
page.content: This is a wealthy farming area . The land is divided up between a number of local tennants, but mainly belongs to a large estate. The farmer who cultivates the largest section of the land in the survey has about 8OO acres under his control. At the busiest time of the year, i.e. harvest, there may be up to seven men working on this farm but it is more generally only two or three.A four year rotation system is common in this area and generally includes permutations of hay, beans, winter wheat, spring barley, sugar beet and oil seed rape. The rotation operates as follows:- Sugar Beet/Oil Seed Rape/Beans Spring Barley Winter Wheat Winter Wheat or Winter Barley Winter Barley
